qas.question: Southampton's railways provide freight services and what other important services?
What's the name of the main train station in Southampton?
Heading east from Southampton, what city is connected by rail?
In which direction do trains run from Southampton to Winchester?
In what year did the rail route from Southampton to London open?

context: Southampton is also served by the rail network, which is used both by freight services to and from the docks and <a0_0>passenger services<a0_0/> as part of the national rail system. The main station in the city is <a1_0>Southampton Central<a1_0/>. Rail routes run east towards <a2_0>Portsmouth<a2_0/>, <a3_0>north<a3_0/> to Winchester, the Midlands and London, and westwards to Bournemouth, Poole, Dorchester, Weymouth, Salisbury, Bristol and Cardiff. The route to London was opened in <a4_0>1840<a4_0/> by what was to become the London and South Western Railway Company. Both this and its successor the Southern Railway (UK) played a significant role in the creation of the modern port following their purchase and development of the town's docks.
